oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Emil Willimetz's Alabama Field Trip Report
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Field notes from trip to Altoona and Hokes Bluff, AL by Emil Willimetz. He describes his efforts to engage reluctant communities in labor organization and community programs. These communities had prior failed attempts to organize by the Farmers Union that made them reluctant to invest more energy into new activities. He notes that "TV is one more hinderance to community meetings in addition to the inertia."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Willimetz, Emil, 1918-2003
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Labor unions--Organizing--United States; Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Communities; Home demonstration work; Farmers; Libraries and community; Children's libraries; Farmers Union (U.S.); Leadership; Soil conservation; Community organization; American Legion; Cooperation
